verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, saying ,
Arise , and go down to the potter’s house , and there I will cause thee to hear my words.
Then I went down to the potter’s house , and, behold , he wrought a work on the wheels.\f + \fr 18.3 \ft wheels: or, frames, or, seats\f*

And the vessel that he made of clay was marred in the hand of the potter : so he made it again another vessel , as seemed good to the potter to make \add it\add*.\f + \fr 18.4 \ft of clay…: or, was marred, as clay in the hand of the potter\f*\f + \fr 18.4 \ft made it…: Heb. returned and made, etc\f*
Then the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came to me, saying ,

O house of Israel , cannot I do with you as this potter ? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. Behold, as the clay \add is\add* in the potter’s hand , so \add are\add* ye in mine hand , O house of Israel.
\add At what\add* instant I shall speak concerning a nation , and concerning a kingdom , to pluck up , and to pull down , and to destroy \add it;\add*
If that nation , against whom I have pronounced , turn from their evil , I will repent of the evil that I thought to do unto them.
And \add at what\add* instant I shall speak concerning a nation , and concerning a kingdom , to build and to plant \add it;\add*
If it do evil in my sight , that it obey not my voice , then I will repent of the good , wherewith I said I would benefit them. \p

¶ Now therefore go to, speak to the men of Judah , and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem , saying , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Behold, I frame evil against you, and devise a device against you: return ye now every one from his evil way , and make your ways and your doings good.
And they said , There is no hope : but we will walk after our own devices , and we will every one do the imagination of his evil heart.
Therefore thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Ask ye now among the heathen , who hath heard such things: the virgin of Israel hath done a very horrible thing.

Will \add a man\add* leave the snow of Lebanon \add which cometh\add* from the rock of the field ? \add or\add* shall the cold flowing waters that come from another place be forsaken ?\f + \fr 18.14 \ft the snow…: or, my fields for a rock, or for the snow of Lebanon? shall the running waters be forsaken for the strange cold waters?\f*

Because my people hath forgotten me, they have burned incense to vanity , and they have caused them to stumble in their ways \add from\add* the ancient paths , to walk in paths , \add in\add* a way not cast up ;
To make their land desolate , \add and\add* a perpetual hissing ; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished , and wag his head.
I will scatter them as with an east wind before the enemy ; I will shew them the back , and not the face , in the day of their calamity. \p

¶ Then said they, Come , and let us devise devices against Jeremiah ; for the law shall not perish from the priest , nor counsel from the wise , nor the word from the prophet. Come , and let us smite him with the tongue , and let us not give heed to any of his words.\f + \fr 18.18 \ft with…: or, for the tongue\f*
Give heed to me, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and hearken to the voice of them that contend with me.
Shall evil be recompensed for good ? for they have digged a pit for my soul. Remember that I stood before thee to speak good for them, \add and\add* to turn away thy wrath from them.

Therefore deliver up their children to the famine , and pour out their \add blood\add* by the force of the sword ; and let their wives be bereaved of their children, and \add be\add* widows ; and let their men be put to death ; \add let\add* their young men \add be\add* slain by the sword in battle.\f + \fr 18.21 \ft pour…: Heb. pour them out\f*
Let a cry be heard from their houses , when thou shalt bring a troop suddenly upon them: for they have digged a pit to take me, and hid snares for my feet.

Yet, \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, thou knowest all their counsel against me to slay \add me:\add* forgive not their iniquity , neither blot out their sin from thy sight , but let them be overthrown before thee; deal \add thus\add* with them in the time of thine anger.\f + \fr 18.23 \ft to slay…: Heb. for death\f*
